member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.Strings.DecoderValidationFallback
member.summary: Provides a failure-handling mechanism, called a fallback, for an encoded input byte sequence that cannot be converted to an output character. The fallback emits a replacement character ï¿½ (U+FFFD, "REPLACEMENT CHARACTER") instead of a decoded input byte sequence and informs in its property whether an error has occurred.

remarks.para: Use objects with the methods
The object is passed as a object.

The class behaves like the class, except that it informs after use in its property whether an error has occurred. To evaluate the property, You should keep a reference to the object or cast the return value of the Encoding.DecoderFallback property to the Type .
When using the object multiple times, the method can be called to reset the property.

member.summary: Indicates whether a decoding error occurred.
member.value: true if an error occurred, false otherwise.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.DecoderValidationFallback.Reset
member.summary: Resets the property to its initial value false.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.FileInfoExtension.IsUtf8(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tests whether the portion of the file specified by that extends at least characters from the beginning of the file is UTF-8 text. The method includes the byte order mark (BOM) in the check.
member.param: A object that references the file to check.

The minimum number of characters to check. If the parameter is passed a negative number or if is greater than the length of the data in the specified file, the entire file is checked. If 0 is passed to the parameter, the method only checks the byte order mark (BOM).
member.returns: true if the checked file section represents UTF-8 text, false otherwise. In any case, if the method finds a UTF-8 BOM, it returns true. If is 0 and no UTF-8 BOM is found, false is returned.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.FileInfoExtension.IsUtf8Valid(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tests whether the portion of the file specified by that extends at least characters from the beginning of the file represents valid UTF-8.
member.param: A object that references the file to check.

The minimum number of characters to check. If a negative number is passed to the parameter (default) or if is greater than the length of the data in the specified file, the entire file is checked. The value 0 is not allowed.
member.returns: true if the checked file section represents valid UTF-8, false otherwise.

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.Strings.PersistentStringHash
member.summary: Combines the hash code for multiple character based values into a single persistent hash code.
member.param: The type of hash code.

para.note: Keep in mind that this is a value type. Don't forget the ref keyword when passing instances to other methods!

remarks.para: The method String.GetHashCode() returns a different hash code for an identical string with each program run for security reasons. Apart from the fact that the hash algorithm of String.GetHashCode() could be different in different framework versions, it makes no sense to use the return value of for reuse. The alternatives, e.g. or , use more storage space and are slower. This struct offers a slim alternative that is suitable for hashing very short strings that are not used in a security-critical context.
The hashcode generated by this method is not identical to the hashcode generated by the .NET Framework 4.0, because it uses roundshifting to preserve more information.
The hashcodes generated with different values for may provide different hashcodes for an identical Char sequence and MUST therefore not be mixed.
Do not use the hashcodes generated by this method for security-critical purposes (such as hashing passwords)!

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.ReadOnlySpanExtension.GetPersistentHashCode(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},FolkerKinzel.Strings.HashType)
member.summary: Generates the same hash code for an identical string of characters each time the program is run.
member.param: The sequence to be hashed.
The kind of hashcode to be generated.
member.returns: The hashcode.

remarks.para: The method String.GetHashCode() returns a different hash code for an identical string with each program run for security reasons. Apart from the fact that the hash algorithm of String.GetHashCode() could be different in different framework versions, it makes no sense to use the return value of for reuse. The alternatives, e.g. or , use more storage space and are slower. This method offers a slim alternative that is suitable for hashing very short strings that are not used in a security-critical context.
The hashcode generated by this method is not identical to the hashcode generated by the .NET Framework 4.0, because it uses roundshifting to preserve more information.
The hashcodes generated with different values for may provide different hashcodes for an identical sequence and MUST therefore not be mixed.
Do not use the hashcodes generated by this method for security-critical purposes (such as hashing passwords)!

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.SpanExtension.GetPersistentHashCode(System.Span{System.Char},FolkerKinzel.Strings.HashType)
member.summary: Generates the same hash code for an identical string of characters each time the program is run.
member.param: The Char sequence to be hashed.
The kind of hashcode to be generated.
member.returns: The hashcode.

remarks.para: The method String.GetHashCode() returns a different hash code for an identical string with each program run for security reasons. Apart from the fact that the hash algorithm of String.GetHashCode() could be different in different framework versions, it makes no sense to use the return value of for reuse. The alternatives, e.g. or , use more storage space and are slower. This method offers a slim alternative that is suitable for hashing very short strings that are not used in a security-critical context.
The hashcode generated by this method is not identical to the hashcode generated by the .NET Framework 4.0, because it uses roundshifting to preserve more information.
The hashcodes generated with different values for may provide different hashcodes for an identical Char sequence and MUST therefore not be mixed.
Do not use the hashcodes generated by this method for security-critical purposes (such as hashing passwords)!

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.StreamExtension.IsUtf8(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tests whether the specified section of that extends at least decoded characters from the current is UTF-8 text. The method includes the byte order mark (BOM) in the check.
member.param: The to test.

The minimum number of characters to check. If is larger than has data, is examined beginning from the current until EOF. If the parameter is passed a negative number or if is greater than the length of the data in , is checked from the current position until EOF. If 0 is passed to the parameter, the method only checks the byte order mark (BOM).
true to leave the stream open after the method has finished; otherwise, false.
member.returns: true if the checked stream section represents UTF-8 text, false otherwise. In any case, if the method finds a UTF-8 BOM, it returns true. If is 0 and no UTF-8 BOM is found, false is returned.
member.exception: doesn't support read and seek operations.

member.param: The to test.

The minimum number of characters to check. If a negative number is passed to the parameter (default) or if is greater than the length of the data in , is checked beginning from its current until EOF. The value 0 is not allowed.
true to leave the stream open after the method has finished; otherwise, false.
member.returns: true if the checked stream section represents valid UTF-8, false otherwise.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.StringBuilderExtension.GetPersistentHashCode(System.Text.StringBuilder,FolkerKinzel.Strings.HashType)
member.summary: Generates the same hash code for an identical string of characters each time the program is run.
member.param: The Char sequence to be hashed.
The kind of hashcode to be generated.
member.returns: The hashcode.

remarks.para: The method String.GetHashCode() returns a different hash code for an identical string with each program run for security reasons. Apart from the fact that the hash algorithm of String.GetHashCode() could be different in different framework versions, it makes no sense to use the return value of for reuse. The alternatives, e.g. or , use more storage space and are slower. This method offers a slim alternative that is suitable for hashing very short strings that are not used in a security-critical context.
The hashcode generated by this method is not identical to the hashcode generated by the .NET Framework 4.0, because it uses roundshifting to preserve more information.
The hashcodes generated with different values for may provide different hashcodes for an identical Char sequence and MUST therefore not be mixed.
Do not use the hashcodes generated by this method for security-critical purposes (such as hashing passwords)!

member.exception: is not a defined value of the enum.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.StringExtension.GetPersistentHashCode(System.String,FolkerKinzel.Strings.HashType)
member.summary: Generates the same hash code for an identical string of characters each time the program is run.
member.param: The Char sequence to be hashed.
The kind of hashcode to be generated.
member.returns: The hashcode.

remarks.para: The method String.GetHashCode() returns a different hash code for an identical string with each program run for security reasons. Apart from the fact that the hash algorithm of String.GetHashCode() could be different in different framework versions, it makes no sense to use the return value of for reuse. The alternatives, e.g. or , use more storage space and are slower. This method offers a slim alternative that is suitable for hashing very short strings that are not used in a security-critical context.
The hashcode generated by this method is not identical to the hashcode generated by the .NET Framework 4.0, because it uses roundshifting to preserve more information.
The hashcodes generated with different values for may provide different hashcodes for an identical Char sequence and MUST therefore not be mixed.
Do not use the hashcodes generated by this method for security-critical purposes (such as hashing passwords)!

member.exception: is not a defined value of the enum.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.StringPolyfillExtension.ReplaceLineEndings(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces all newlines in with .
member.param: The source .
member.returns: A whose contents match the content of , but with all newline sequences replaced with .

remarks.para: This is a polyfill for the .NET 6.0 method String.ReplaceLineEndings(). The method should therefore only be used in the extension method syntax. It throws a if is null in order to show identical behavior to the original .NET method.

The method searches for all newline sequences within and canonicalizes them to match the newline sequence for the current environment. For example, when running on Windows, all occurrences of non-Windows Newline sequences are replaced with the sequence CRLF. When running on Unix, all occurrences of non-Unix Newline sequences are replaced with a single LF character.
The list of recognized newline sequences is:
This list is specified by the Unicode standard (Sec. 5.8, Recommendation R4 and Table 5-2).

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.TextEncodingConverter.GetCodePage(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Examines a text file, to see if it starts with a Byte Order Mark (BOM), and returns an appropriate code page. (The fallback value is 65001 for UTF-8.)
member.param: Path to the file to examine.
When the method returns, it contains the length of the BOM found or zero if no BOM was found. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: An appropriate code page for the text file or the code page for UTF-8 (65001) if the code page could not be determined from the byte order mark.
member.remarks:
The method recognizes the byte order marks for the following character sets:
UTF-8
UTF-16LE
UTF-16BE
UTF-32LE
UTF-32BE
UTF-7
GB18030
UTF-16LE, UTF-16BE, UTF-32LE and UTF-32BE can also be recognized by the method from the data if there is no Byte Order Mark.
member.exception: is not a valid file path.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.Strings.TextEncodingConverter.GetCodePage(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Examines a read-only span, that represents the contents of a text file, to see if it starts with a Byte Order Mark (BOM), and returns an appropriate code page. (The fallback value is 65001 for UTF-8.)
member.param: The span to examine. It should be at least 4 s long.
When the method returns, it contains the length of the BOM found or zero if no BOM was found. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: An appropriate code page for or the code page for UTF-8 (65001) if the code page could not be determined from .
member.remarks:
The method recognizes the byte order marks for the following character sets:
UTF-8
UTF-16LE
UTF-16BE
UTF-32LE
UTF-32BE
UTF-7
GB18030
UTF-16LE, UTF-16BE, UTF-32LE and UTF-32BE can also be recognized by the method from the data if there is no Byte Order Mark.
